Hand Signals Used in Land Surveying
There are times on a jobsite when crew members may be too far away from one another to hear each other. In these situations, Land Surveyors and Construction workers use hand signals to communicate over distance and noise.DUTIES OF A CHAINING CREW MEMBERDuring a typical chaining operation, it is possible that many and varied duties other thanthe actual chaining itself are to be undertaken as part of the whole process. To prepare the field chaining party for the...

articles.description: Download this collection of Surveying Articles added to the community so far!  The articles within are geared to help new surveyors get a better understanding of what is expected of them and as such, will not be totally applicable to all areas of the world. We need to know if what is presented applies in your location.  If not, please tell us the differences.
